statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Drake 69, Detroit 61
article.story: DES MOINES, Iowa (AP) -- Jonathan Cox, a walk-on playing his first college game, and Chaun Brooks scored 13 points apiece and Drake used two second-half runs to beat Detroit 69-61 on Sunday. Another player in his first game with the Bulldogs (1-0), junior-college transfer Al Stewart, had a solid debut at point guard with eight points, eight assists and four steals. Stewart keyed Drake's full-court pressure defense, which forced Detroit (1-1) into 24 turnovers in the first basketball game at the recently opened Wells Fargo Arena. The Bulldogs made 15 steals and finished with a 23-15 edge in points off turnovers. Chuck Bailey led Detroit with 16 points and 11 rebounds. Brandon Cotton scored 14 but shot just 6-for-17. Drake trailed 48-42 after a 16-2 Detroit run, then answered with a 14-2 burst. Stewart started it with a driving basket and finished it with two lob passes to Ajay Calvin, who had 10 points. Calvin dunked on the first pass and banked in a layup on the second, making it 56-50 with 7:14 left. Detroit drew to 56-54 on Bailey's tip-in but never regained the lead. Drake sank eight of 10 free throws in the final 1:15, including four by freshman Jacob Baryenbruch, to secure the victory. Drake broke a 32-all tie by scoring the first eight points of the second half. Brooks finished that run with two baskets, the second after Stewart stole the ball and fired a pass that led to a layup. The Bulldogs couldn't sustain it, though, and Detroit scored 16 of the next 18 points. Cox, who sat out last season as a freshman, shot 5-for-7 and led the Bulldogs with five rebounds. He scored 10 of his points during a 3-minute span late in the first half by making five straight shots, including two layups after Drake stole the ball in its press.
